rows.headline: Djokovic, 31, whose career was wobbling a year ago, has won three straight Grand Slam championships, giving him 15 in all.
rows.description: MELBOURNE, Australia — The first point of the Australian Open men’s final on Sunday told the story of all that was to come.

rows.headline: The 97-year-old Duke of Edinburgh apologized in a letter to a woman who sustained a broken wrist in the accident, British news outlets reported.
rows.description: LONDON — Prince Philip, the 97-year-old husband of Queen Elizabeth II of Britain, has apologized to a woman who was injured in a car crash he was involved in this month, British news outlets reported on Sunday.

rows.headline: Edward Conlon wrote “Blue Blood” before retiring in 2011 to write a novel. He’s back on the job, but has traded in his handcuffs for a keyboard.
rows.description: [What you need to know to start the day: Get New York Today in your inbox.]

rows.headline: In a new documentary, a former South African militia member says his group used phony vaccinations to spread H.I.V. among blacks. Experts are deeply skeptical.
rows.description: STOCKHOLM — When South Africa opened its books on the atrocities of the apartheid era in the 1990s, a tantalizing series of faded documents reignited one of the continent’s enduring mysteries. The records suggested that a white militia, operating with the support of the C.I.A. and British intelligence, orchestrated the 1961 plane crash that killed the United Nations secretary general, Dag Hammarskjold.

rows.headline: A reader asks what the long-term defense against flood-prone tunnels will be.
rows.description: To the Editor:

rows.headline: Mr. de Blasio, the mayor of New York, went to Washington to “preach the gospel” of liberal governance.
rows.description: [What you need to know to start the day: Get New York Today in your inbox.]

rows.headline: The venue said the work, painted on an emergency exit door, was a memorial to the victims of the 2015 terror attacks.
rows.description: A mural painted on the emergency exit door of the Bataclan theater in Paris, attributed to the British street artist Banksy, has been stolen, the venue said in a post on Twitter.

rows.headline: A few landmarks of so-called Brutalist architecture are on the verge of being sold to private developers, prompting a last-ditch scramble by enthusiasts to have the buildings protected.
rows.description: SINGAPORE — On a balmy Friday night, Zara Tan and two friends went drinking at an open-air pop-up bar in Golden Mile Tower, a 1970s-era building with a raw concrete exterior that overlooks Singapore’s financial district.

rows.headline: Caleb Hanna, one of the youngest state legislators in the country, is a black man raised in a white family who represents a predominantly white district in West Virginia.
rows.description: Caleb Hanna was a child when Barack Obama won the White House and, like many African-Americans, he recalled his excitement at seeing “someone who looks like me become president.”

rows.headline: Before and after images show the damage caused by the collapse of a mining dam in Brumadinho, Brazil. At least 58 are dead and hundreds are still missing.
rows.description: Before and after images show the damage caused by the collapse of a mining dam in Brumadinho, Brazil. At least 58 are dead and hundreds are still missing.

rows.headline: It was the second time in two weeks that a New York police union president compared a black person to an animal, a practice long linked to racism.
rows.description: [What you need to know to start the day: Get New York Today in your inbox.]

rows.headline: The idea of an American troop withdrawal fills Afghan women with dread, as they see Westerners as their only protectors not just from the Taliban, but also the “Taliban mentality” among other men.
rows.description: KABUL, Afghanistan — When Rahima Jami heard that the Americans and the Taliban were close to a peace deal, she thought about her feet.

rows.headline: The university is conducting an internal review after a professor sent an email cautioning international students from speaking Chinese on campus.
rows.description: Duke University has apologized after a professor cautioned international students against speaking Chinese on campus and urged them to speak English instead.

rows.headline: On one side of a barricade in remote British Columbia, members of the Wet’suwet’en people hoped to stop a pipeline that would cross their traditional land. On the other side were heavily armed police.
rows.description: HOUSTON, British Columbia — Amid vast forests of spruce, pine and poplar trees, deep in the interior of British Columbia, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police arrived at a small bridge this month to clear a group of First Nations people who had set up a blockade across a narrow, gravel logging road.

rows.headline: Ms. Harris, a Democratic senator from California, described the nation and the world as at “an inflection point” in history. “Who are we as Americans?” she asked at the rally on Sunday.
rows.description: OAKLAND, Calif. — Senator Kamala Harris of California officially kicked off her campaign for the Democratic presidential nomination on Sunday at an outdoor rally where she warned that the nation and the world were at “an inflection point” in history and called on all Americans to “speak truth about what’s happening” in the Trump era.

rows.headline: The president sees things how he sees things.
rows.description: As President Trump presses on with the trade war, observers say he hasn’t wrapped his head around China. The miscalculation is expected to have costs.

rows.headline: President Trump shared disputed figures about the number of undocumented immigrants, what they cost the country and how many had illegally voted in elections.
rows.description: President Trump came away empty-handed for now after the longest federal government shutdown in American history failed to pressure Congress into funding his long-promised border wall, purportedly to stop an inflow of drugs and crime from Mexico.

rows.headline: The Balkans has once again become a playground for great power politics.
rows.description: “In the Balkans the transition is over,” Remzi Lani, an Albanian political analyst, told me some time ago. But unlike in many post-Communist countries, Mr. Lani didn’t mean a transformation from dictatorship to democracy. “We transitioned from repressive to depressive regimes.” He is right. The old Communists and radical ethnic nationalists are largely gone; in their places is stagnation — economic, social and political.

rows.headline: Au nom de la laïcité, elle est en train de déléguer son islam à d’autres pays.
rows.description: PARIS — Que faire de l’islam de France ? Face aux attentats islamistes, aux communautarismes ou aux manipulations internationales des communautés musulmanes, la question est urgente. Mais le sujet fâche, car gérer l’islam semble aller à l’encontre de la laïcité et de la loi de 1905, qui sépare l’État et les Églises.

rows.headline: Only a single state — Minnesota — has a legislature under divided party control, a sign of growing polarization.
rows.description: ST. PAUL — Days after nearly dying during cancer treatments, Hunter Cantrell, a 23-year-old university student, made what seemed a quixotic decision: He would run for the Minnesota House of Representatives to plead for affordable health care for all.
